results.title: Mystery at Fire Island
results.brief_description: It’s kids versus the criminals when the search for a missing friend uncovers an international plot! While vacationing on Fire Island, two young cousins risk danger to help find an old fisherman who has mysteriously disappeared. As the intrigue unfolds and the amateur sleuths find their way to solving the mystery we challenge you to do the same. Rated: G

results.title: Mystery at Castle House (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Maxwell, Brendon Lunney and Independent Productions (AU)
results.brief_description: Spider, an adventurous 12 year old, takes his new friends, Ben and Kate, across the harbour to a deserted old mansion, Castle House. Two other boys disappear before their eyes in the overgrown grounds. The eccentric elderly owner suddenly returns, and Spider and his friends find a secret tunnel. Filmed around the natural bushland and bays of Sydney Harbour. it’s action all the way with enough crazy fun to keep children and their parents spellbound.

results.title: Mysterious object at noon
results.creator_credit: Apichatpong Weerasethakul, Mingmongkol Sonakul, Gridthiya Gaweewong, Firecracker Films, 6 Cinema Factory and 9/6 Cinema Factory
results.brief_description: Drawing on the Surrealist storytelling technique known as Exquisite Corpse, wherein a variety of writers would contribute to a story one sentence at a time, without knowing much about what the previous sentences contained “Mysterious object at noon” is a fragmented, open-ended anti-narrative. Thai independent filmmaker Apichatpong Weerasethakul used the technique to interview people throughout Thailand, learning a little bit about their lives and then asking them to contribute to the film’s evolving story. What emerges is at once a portrait of Thailand’s disenfranchised lower classes - farmers, fruit vendors, village performers of “mor lam” (a song-and-storytelling hybrid extremely popular in the rural northeast) - and a fractured group-narration of a story about a handicapped boy and his tutor, a woman named Dogfar. The finished story was then shot in dramatic form, using nonprofessional actors, and intercut with the earlier footage. An experimental mix of documentary and fiction, this highly unusual and unconventional work challenges defined notions of authorship, authenticity, genre cinema and narrative.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Apichatpong Weerasethakul, Mingmongkol Sonakul, Gridthiya Gaweewong, Firecracker Films, 6 Cinema Factory and 9/6 Cinema Factory

results.title: Mysteries of the ocean wanderers
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Parer-Cook, David Parer, BBC, National Geographic Society and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: The wandering albatross is the largest and most majestic of all sea birds, but until recently little was known about them. This program looks at the work of a team of French scientists on the Crozet Islands, south of South Africa, and their discoveries about this remarkable bird, as well as the teeming summer wildlife of the islands. Narrated by David Attenborough.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elizabeth Parer-Cook, David Parer, BBC, National Geographic Society and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Myst (MAC)
results.brief_description: You are about to be drawn into an amazing alternative reality. ‘Myst’ is a game that was designed from the ground up to draw you in with little or no distractions on the screen to interfere with the feeling of being there. It is non-linear, with the most depth, detail and reality you’ve ever experienced in a game. The key to playing the game is to lose yourself in this fantastic virtual exploration, and act and react as if you were really there.

results.title: Myra Hess
results.brief_description: Dame Myra Hess plays the first movement of Beethoven’s Sonata in F Minor, Opus 57, (Apassionata). Close-ups show the technique of this artist, whose finest quality as a pianist is her sincerity and who was the inspiration of lunchtime concerts during the war in the National Gallery, London.

results.title: Myra (K)
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: When Myra goes to dancing class she leaps, sways and kicks, just as Mrs. Page tells her to. But her enthusiasm and imagination go far beyond Mrs. Page.

results.title: My world: water
results.creator_credit: Paul Fillinger, Chevron Chemical Co and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: A montage of experiences related to the uses and delights of water. Explores the water cycle, importance of water to life, how water gets to our homes, the uses of water and the need for conservation. Uses songs, children’s voices and imaginative photography to highlight importance of water to us. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
